channel.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
channel.description: As simple as it sounds i tried.. not sure what to set mainfest to..so i set it to the only class in there.. but didnt work. i have JARmaker and im pretty sure its simple.

item.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/sun/tools/javac/M
ain
added manifest
adding: HelloFrame.class(in = 2482) (out= 1358)(deflated 45%)
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: HelloFrame (wrong nam
e: JFrame/HelloFrame)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
Press any key to continue . . .

an when i try to run it - couldnt find the main class

Read full topic

item.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Your entire layout of the batch file is again wrong. Make SURE your environmental variables and use the following code WORD BY WORD:

@echo off
javac -cp . *.java
jar -cvfe Games.jar HelloFrame HelloFrame.class
java -jar -cp . Games.jar
pause

Read full topic

its my only class. This was my first GUI./on my own mostly coded program.

On another topic

Frell, leave these forums, come back when you get some common sense

well, maybe if you helped me and didnt flame i would learn.

item.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Go into your jdk directory and copy and paste Jar.exe into the same folder as what your jaring then use this[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:4, topic:106620”]Close, but not quite:

@echo off
title Games
javac -cp . *.java
jar -cvfe Games.jar HelloFrame *.class
java -jar -cp . Games.jar

Try that[/quote]

Then run that^

Read full topic

item.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Usage: javac <options> <source files>
where possible options include:
  -g                         Generate all debugging info
  -g:none                    Generate no debugging info
  -g:{lines,vars,source}     Generate only some debugging info
  -nowarn                    Generate no warnings
  -verbose                   Output messages about what the compiler is doing
  -deprecation               Output source locations where deprecated APIs are u
sed
  -classpath <path>          Specify where to find user class files and annotati
on processors
  -cp <path>                 Specify where to find user class files and annotati
on processors
  -sourcepath <path>         Specify where to find input source files
  -bootclasspath <path>      Override location of bootstrap class files
  -extdirs <dirs>            Override location of installed extensions
  -endorseddirs <dirs>       Override location of endorsed standards path
  -proc:{none,only}          Control whether annotation processing and/or compil
ation is done.
  -processor <class1>[,<class2>,<class3>...]Names of the annotation processors t
o run; bypasses default discovery process
  -processorpath <path>      Specify where to find annotation processors
  -d <directory>             Specify where to place generated class files
  -s <directory>             Specify where to place generated source files
  -implicit:{none,class}     Specify whether or not to generate class files for
implicitly referenced files
  -encoding <encoding>       Specify character encoding used by source files
  -source <release>          Provide source compatibility with specified release

  -target <release>          Generate class files for specific VM version
  -version                   Version information
  -help                      Print a synopsis of standard options
  -Akey[=value]              Options to pass to annotation processors
  -X                         Print a synopsis of nonstandard options
  -J<flag>                   Pass <flag> directly to the runtime system

'jar' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Unable to access jarfile Games.jar
Press any key to continue . . .

is this suppost to happen? and it says jar is not blah blah blah.

Read full topic

item.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

your path value should be “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk[version]\bin”

Read full topic

item.title: Jaring a source code.. Help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

like this?

@echo off
title Games
java -cp jar -cvfe Games.jar HelloFrame.class HelloFrame.class ToAdd.class[can use wildcard *]
pause

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

dont use a jarmaker, learn to use the jdk…

jar -cvfe MyJarName.jar MyMainClassName MyClass(es)ToAdd.class[can use wildcard *]
